CN.content:
Please identify the "Material Name" entities in the following paragraph.

Paragraph: † PTATDPP showed a best PCE of 6.69% ( V OC = 0.80 V , J SC = 12.3 mA cm^-2 , FF = 0.68 ) , while PTAFDPP showed a best PCE of 5.02% ( V OC = 0.76 V , J SC = 11.2 mA cm^-2 , FF = 0.59 ).

Let's think step by step.

In the given paragraph, the following are the "Material Name" entities:

1. PTATDPP: This is the name of the material being tested, which is a type of perovskite material.
2. PTAFDPP: This is another name of the material being tested, which is also a type of perovskite material.

So, the two material names mentioned in the paragraph are:

1. PTATDPP
2. PTAFDPP
Please remove irrelevant entities and only keep the entities that clearly refer to Material Name.

Sure, here are the material names mentioned in the paragraph:

1. PTATDPP
2. PTAFDPP

Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Material Name".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

Certainly! Here are the valid material names mentioned in the paragraph:

| Material Name |
| --- |
| PTATDPP |
| PTAFDPP |

PN.content:
Please identify the "Property Name" entities in the following paragraph.

Paragraph: † PTATDPP showed a best PCE of 6.69% ( V OC = 0.80 V , J SC = 12.3 mA cm^-2 , FF = 0.68 ) , while PTAFDPP showed a best PCE of 5.02% ( V OC = 0.76 V , J SC = 11.2 mA cm^-2 , FF = 0.59 ).

Let's think step by step.

In the given paragraph, the following are the "Property Name" entities:

1. PTATDPP: This is the name of the property being described, which refers to the power conversion efficiency (PCE) of a particular device.
2. PTAFDPP: This is another name for the same property, which is being compared to the PCE of the first device.
3. V OC: This stands for "open-circuit voltage," which is a measure of the voltage across the device when it is not connected to a load.
4. J SC: This stands for "short-circuit current," which is a measure of the current flowing through the device when it is connected to a short circuit.
5. FF: This stands for "fill factor," which is a measure of the efficiency of the device in converting light energy into electrical energy.

So, the "Property Name" entities in the paragraph are PTATDPP and PTAFDPP, which are the names of the properties being compared.
Please remove irrelevant entities and only keep the entities that clearly refer to Material Property.

Sure, here are the relevant entities in the paragraph that refer to material properties:

1. PCE: This stands for "power conversion efficiency," which is a measure of the efficiency of the device in converting light energy into electrical energy.
2. V OC: This stands for "open-circuit voltage," which is a measure of the voltage across the device when it is not connected to a load.
3. J SC: This stands for "short-circuit current," which is a measure of the current flowing through the device when it is connected to a short circuit.

So, the relevant entities in the paragraph that refer to material properties are:

1. PCE
2. V OC
3. J SC

Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Property Name".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

Certainly! Here are the valid entities in the paragraph that refer to material properties, presented in a Markdown table with one column "Property Name":

| Property Name |
| --- |
| PCE |
| V OC |
| J SC |

I hope this helps! Let me know if you have any further questions.

PV.content:
Please identify the "Property Value" entities in the following paragraph.

Paragraph: † PTATDPP showed a best PCE of 6.69% ( V OC = 0.80 V , J SC = 12.3 mA cm^-2 , FF = 0.68 ) , while PTAFDPP showed a best PCE of 5.02% ( V OC = 0.76 V , J SC = 11.2 mA cm^-2 , FF = 0.59 ).

Let's think step by step.

In the given paragraph, the following are the "Property Value" entities:

1. PCE (Photovoltaic Conversion Efficiency) - This is the entity that represents the percentage of sunlight converted into electrical energy by the solar cell.
2. VOC (Open Circuit Voltage) - This is the entity that represents the voltage of the solar cell when it is not connected to a load.
3. JSC (Short Circuit Current) - This is the entity that represents the current of the solar cell when it is not connected to a load.
4. FF (Fill Factor) - This is the entity that represents the ratio of the maximum power that can be produced by the solar cell to the power that is actually produced when it is connected to a load.

So, the Property Value entities in the paragraph are:

PCE: 6.69% (for PTATDPP) and 5.02% (for PTAFDPP)
VOC: 0.80 V (for PTATDPP) and 0.76 V (for PTAFDPP)
JSC: 12.3 mA cm^-2 (for PTATDPP) and 11.2 mA cm^-2 (for PTAFDPP)
FF: 0.68 (for PTATDPP) and 0.59 (for PTAFDPP)
Please remove irrelevant entities and only keep the entities that clearly refer to Value of Material Property.

Sure, here are the entities that refer to the value of material properties in the paragraph:

1. PCE (Photovoltaic Conversion Efficiency) - This is the entity that represents the percentage of sunlight converted into electrical energy by the solar cell.
2. VOC (Open Circuit Voltage) - This is the entity that represents the voltage of the solar cell when it is not connected to a load.

So, the relevant entities in the paragraph are:

PCE: 6.69% (for PTATDPP) and 5.02% (for PTAFDPP)
VOC: 0.80 V (for PTATDPP) and 0.76 V (for PTAFDPP)

Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Property Value".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

Certainly! Here are the valid entities in the paragraph, presented as a Markdown table with one column "Property Value":

| Property Value |
| --- |
| 6.69% (PCE) |
| 0.80 V (VOC) |
| 12.3 mA cm^-2 (JSC) |
| 0.68 (FF) |

I hope this helps! Let me know if you have any further questions.
